Body: I followed a tutorial to send message to the hiveMQ(which run through executing run.bat file that I downloaded from their website) from paho graphical user interface downloaded from here
column9: it worked fine and showed logs that client connected and sent message that worked fine
column10: now I have made android client application that can publish messages to the public broker
column11:
that also worked fine I successfully published message to their public broker(tcp://broker.hivemq.com:1883)

I want to have hiveMQ as broker on my computer so that I can send messages from my application to locally running broker and see the message what I sent from application

Body:
Assuming you run the default HiveMQ configuration, you can reach the broker via your computer's IP address on port 1883. So if you run the application on the same computer as the HiveMQ: Broker Address: tcp://127.0.0.1:1883

Otherwise: use ifconfig (Mac/Linux) or ipconfig(Windows) command in terminal to determine your external or internal IP-address

Broker Address: tcp://'ip-adress':1883.
